SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
This class implements the ViewListener, representing the actual GameController. The Controller is used as an intermediary between the Server and the model in order to evaluate and perform any of the Player actions.

It provides a series of methods to reference the current state of the Game (such as IN_CREATION, ON_GOING, FINISHING, ...) and some other methods used for turn and chat management, input insertion, retrieving goals information... linked to other primary game functions.

See Also:
  • Player
  • Game
  • state

    • sendPrivateMessage

      public void sendPrivateMessage(String receiver, String sender, String content)
      This method is used to stream a message privately. Only the specified receiver will be able to read the message. It builds a new object message at each call, setting the nicknames of the receiving Players and its message type to PRIVATE.
      Parameters:
      receiver - the Player receiving the message.
      sender - the Player sending the message.
      content - the text of the message being sent.
      See Also:
      • Player
      • Player.getNickname()
      • Message.messageType()

    • sendBroadcastMessage

      public void sendBroadcastMessage(String sender, String content)
      This method is used to stream a message in broadcast mode. All the players will be able to read the message. It builds a new object message at each call, setting the nickname of the sending Player and its message type to BROADCAST.
      Parameters:
      sender - the Player sending the message.
      content - the text of the message being sent.
      See Also:
      • Player
      • Player.getNickname()
      • Message.messageType()

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(String nickname) throws LobbyIsFullException
      This method is used to add a Player to the current Game through the nickname he has chosen during game creation and to assign a player a randomly chosen PersonalGoal. In order to provide the goal it as to access the GameController to get the number of persona goals for each player.

      All the added players are characterized by Bookshelf, PersonalGoal and an array of ScoreTile elements.

      The method also sets the connection state of any given Player to true.

      Parameters:
      nickname - is the reference for the name of the Player being added.
      Throws:
      LobbyIsFullException - when lobby is full of players or the given nickname is not in the allowed ones.
      See Also:
      • PersonalGoal
      • getNumberOfPersonalGoals()

    • tryToResumeGame

      public void tryToResumeGame()
      Signals that an attempt of resuming the game is in progress, modifying the related state.

    • chooseNumberOfPlayerInTheGame

      public void chooseNumberOfPlayerInTheGame(int chosenNumberOfPlayers)
      Method to implement the selection of the number of players for the Game.
      Parameters:
      chosenNumberOfPlayers - identifies the number of players present in the lobby during the game creation.
      See Also:
      • Game
      • Game.getPlayers()

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      The method starts verifying if the Game creation has occurred properly, confronting the number of active players registered during the previous phase with that stored in the Model. Then, it proceeds to adjust the Board and to draw a list of Tiles. Finally, it initializes the ScoreTile list for each active Player, (necessary in order to replace them later if a player complete a CommonGoal).
      See Also:
      • Game
      • Player
      • ScoreTile
      • CommonGoal
      • Game.getNumberOfPlayersToStartGame()
      • Game.getPlayers()
      • Board.setPattern(JsonBoardPattern)
      • Board.numberOfTilesToRefill()

    • checkExceedingPlayer

      public void checkExceedingPlayer(int chosenNumberOfPlayers) throws ExcessOfPlayersException, WrongInputDataException
      Checks if there are some player in excess within the game lobby that shouldn't be connected.
      Parameters:
      chosenNumberOfPlayers - number of player chosen by the first player
      Throws:
      ExcessOfPlayersException - if there is an excess of player in the lobby when starting
      WrongInputDataException - when input data is not valid.
      See Also:
      • CreationState.checkExceedingPlayer(int)
      • FinishingState.checkExceedingPlayer(int)
      • InPauseState.checkExceedingPlayer(int)
      • OnGoingState.checkExceedingPlayer(int)

    • disconnectPlayer

      public void disconnectPlayer(String nickname)
      Disconnects the selected Player from the Game by changing his connectivity state. (only possible when the Game has already started).
      Parameters:
      nickname - is the nickname identifying the player selected for disconnection.
      See Also:
